intro: Tephrosia cuernavacana, commonly known as the Cuernavaca tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
